meanings.definition: a type of dance popular in the 1960s
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone was doing the boogaloos on the dance floor.
meanings.sent2: The boogaloos were a hit at the dance competition.
meanings.sent3: The boogaloos at the school talent show were full of energy and fun.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves were like boogaloos, smooth and rhythmic.
meanings.sent5: The boogaloos they performed were so lively, it was hard not to join in.

meanings.definition: a slang term for money or cash
meanings.sent1: He needed some boogaloos to buy a new video game.
meanings.sent2: She counted her boogaloos before heading to the store.
meanings.sent3: The kids were excited to earn some extra boogaloos by helping with chores.
meanings.sent4: His wallet was filled with boogaloos after his birthday.
meanings.sent5: The boogaloos in his pocket jingled as he walked.

meanings.definition: a term used to describe a group of people or things in a casual or informal way
meanings.sent1: The boogaloos at the park were having a picnic.
meanings.sent2: She invited all her boogaloos to the movie night.
meanings.sent3: The boogaloos in the office always shared snacks during breaks.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship group was like a bunch of boogaloos, always together.
meanings.sent5: The boogaloos in the neighborhood were known for their block parties.
